titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that student travel is a vital component of the educational process.
Expressing the sense of the Congress that student travel is a vital component of the educational process.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.
Mr. Porter moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 131.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Education and the Workforce
committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of Congress that student travel: (1) is a vital component of the educational process; and (2) should be encouraged so that Americans, young and old, can participate in travel, the perfect freedom.
